normalised: The Curious Case of the Missing Joint Secretary and the Vanishing Files

unnormalised: In the labyrinthine corridors of power, where files gather dust faster than you can say “bureaucratic red tape,” a rather peculiar incident unfolded last week. It all began when Joint Secretary Sharma, a man known for his meticulously organized desk (a claim disputed by his subordinates), discovered a rather alarming discrepancy. The files pertaining to the ‘National Goat Development Program,’ a project of utmost (alleged) importance, had vanished.

The files pertaining to the ‘National Goat Development Program,’ a project of utmost (alleged) importance, had vanished.

unnormalised: Now, JS Sharma, as he’s fondly (or not so fondly) called, is not easily flustered. After all, he’s survived countless transfers, dealt with ministers who thought PowerPoint was a new type of spice, and navigated office politics with the finesse of a seasoned diplomat. But missing files, especially ones involving goats and national development, well, that’s a different kettle of fish (or should we say, a different pen of goats?).

unnormalised: The initial reaction, of course, was to blame the peon, Raju. Raju, a man whose dedication to chai consumption far outweighs his commitment to filing, vehemently denied any involvement. “Sir, I only bring chai! I don’t touch files! Ask UDC Verma Sahab!”

unnormalised: UDC Verma, the Upper Division Clerk, a position that sounds far grander than it is, was predictably unavailable. He was reportedly attending a ‘vital’ training session on ‘Efficient Tea Break Management’ at the nearby CCD.

unnormalised: This sent JS Sharma into a mild panic. He summoned the Under Secretary, US Tripathi, a man who spends more time polishing his spectacles than doing actual work. “Tripathi ji,” he thundered (as much as one can thunder with a slight paunch and receding hairline), “find those files! The Hon’ble Minister is very keen to know about the goat situation!”

unnormalised: US Tripathi, in a moment of sheer brilliance (or perhaps just blind luck), suggested checking the canteen. Why the canteen, you ask? Well, it turns out that the canteen serves a mean ‘Mutton Rogan Josh’ and some suspect that… well, let's just say some of those 'National Goat Development Program' goats might have contributed to the recipe.

unnormalised: The search began. It was a chaotic affair, involving disgruntled clerks, suspicious peons, and one very confused stenographer who kept typing "Goat. Development. Rogan Josh." The files, however, were nowhere to be found.

unnormalised: Finally, after hours of frantic searching, the mystery was solved. JS Sharma, in his infinite wisdom, had moved the files himself. He’d placed them… wait for it… inside the empty biscuit tin on his desk, thinking it was a "clever hiding place". The 'National Goat Development Program' was safe (for now), Raju was exonerated, UDC Verma returned from his tea break a wiser man and US Tripathi’s spectacles shone even brighter, reflecting the sheer relief in the room. One can only hope that in coming days Mr. Joint secretary would take a break from his important responsibilities to get a decent memory checkup.
